sense.name: one human being
sense.examples: There was too much for one person to do. The room's occupancy was limited to 80 persons. She thought of herself as a well-educated person.

sense.name: area around a body
sense.commentary: Refers to the immediate area around an individual's body, usually to their pockets, clothing, etc. Usually only relevant when describing what somebody carries around with them.
sense.examples: A weapon was hidden on his person. We found a thousand dollars worth of heroin, carried on his person.

sense.name: grammatical category
sense.commentary: The point-of-view of a narrative or verbal act. There are only three kinds of person: first, second, and third.
sense.examples: John sometimes talked about himself in the third person. I prefer novels that are written in the first person. You rarely see stories written in the second person, do you?
